column5: What a day! The winds finally laid down and the water was flatter than pee on a plate. I was lucky enough to hook with a fellow OFC'er and grab some smallies out of Maitland.  These two were caught on a watermelon/chartreuse YUM Dinger rigged wacky with an O-ring.     This one was the smallest of the lot but fought like he was going to the chair. It was caught on a Strike King Bleeding Tube (3.5") in Dark Melon Perch     I attribute my success to wearing my PFD at all times and my darned smart looking hat. Good to get out with you Homeslice. Jim
Right on Jim Looks like the perfect day to get into some bassin!!! Great job and thanks for sharing Leechman

I truly enjoyed being your net man today *sigh* and photographer and ......*sobs* But I most enjoyed the time on the water and I learned that there are actually other places to fish rather than the grand between erie and the dam. If ever you would like a repeat performance, just call.
Nice fish, beauty day on Erie no comment on the hat
sweet day to be out, guys, one of the nicest days so far this summer!
WTG on a successful ( for some) outing.
those are some very nice bass, glad you could get out on such a nice day.  the wacky rig will get em everytime.  jason
Nice! If conditions are calm   my wife and I will be heading to the same area this morning...that is whenever she wakes up! It's already 4:30 AM
Great going.. I think that might be only the second time this year I have seen Erie calm
